section: Exercise 4.20.1: Applying the pigeonhole principle -  heights and times.
instructions: Apply the pigeonhole principle to answer the following questions. If the pigeonhole principle can not be applied, give a specific counterexample.
question:
(a)

A team of three high jumpers all have a personal record that is at least 6 feet and less than 7 feet. Is it necessarily true that two of the team members must have personal records that are within four inches of each other? What if there are four jumpers? Heights are measured to within a precision of 1/4 inch.
answer:
If there are only three jumpers, then their personal records could be 6', 6' 5.5", 6' 11".
The three heights are all at least five inches apart.
